1497067396883959808.text: Putin’s ambitions know no bounds. America, NATO, and our allies must be resolute in defense of democracy.

1497067395751501827.text: Our grievance is not with the Russian people, and it is unfortunate that they will be the ones to bear the greatest burden of the international response. Putin bears responsibility for their suffering every bit as much as he is responsible for the tragedy unfolding in Ukraine.

1497067394509983744.text: Additional sanctions must directly target Vladimir Putin, Russian elites, the Russian military and the country’s financial institutions.

1497067393537003520.text: We see Vladimir Putin for what he is: a warmongering, dictatorial tyrant who seeks a permanent conflict with the West and restoration of Russian rule over the former Soviet empire.

1497067392651902979.text: We will continue to assist Ukraine and the Ukrainian people with the resources necessary to defend their country and humanitarian assistance to feed and provide for their citizens.

1497067391712387074.text: It is imperative for the US to resolutely lead with our allies in preserving the united response to Putin’s war.  We must stand together to support the people of Ukraine and also work in unison to mitigate the impact Putin’s illegal aggression will have on the global economy.

1497067390638641168.text: Putin is counting on the unity of the international community to fracture and wane in short order.  We must ensure that his confidence is misplaced and that his intentions are thwarted.

1497067389644591106.text: Vladimir Putin’s war against Ukraine is not just an unprovoked, illegal invasion of a sovereign country, but a blatant attack on the world order—an affront to every nation that respects international law and national self-determination.

1497067388017074180.text: America and the world stand with the People of Ukraine.

1496264668976930818.text: Congress must ensure the U.S., with NATO and our European partners, is fully equipped to counter Putin and Russia’s warmongering and revanchist ambitions.

1496264666854658048.text: It is critically important for Congress to demonstrate, with broad bipartisan support, the U.S. commitment to international law and security, and the independence of the people of Ukraine.

1496264665923530752.text: I commend President Biden’s strong and swift response, uniting our NATO allies in combatting the belligerent Russian threat, and I stand ready in Congress to support and bolster these actions to hold Putin accountable.

1496264664841342978.text: Putin’s illegal escalation poses the greatest security threat to Europe and the world in decades.

1496264663952207873.text: Putin’s theater of lies is fooling no one — sending Russian troops into eastern Ukraine is the beginning of an invasion and a blatant violation of both international law and Ukraine’s sovereignty. The world must respond appropriately.

1496264662907826177.text: Putin’s moves in Ukraine are an affront to the democratic will of the Ukrainian people to determine their own future, and a flagrant and dangerous challenge to international law and security.

1496264656729612294.text: The security of the United States is inextricably tied to upholding the universal commitment to international law, sovereign borders, and every nation's right to self-governance. 🧵

1482821548381814795.text: Two things Congress can do immediately: (1) help Jewish institutions afford security enhancements, and (2) move forward on the appointment of Deborah Lipstadt as US Envoy to Combat and Monitor Antisemitism.

1482821547257737216.text: The American white nationalist who murdered 11 worshipers at the Tree of Life Synagogue and the British national who held 4 worshipers captive at Congregation Beth Israel shared nothing in common—nothing but their choice to attack and terrorize Jews.

1482821546251100173.text: The answers to all these questions are rooted in the simple reality of antisemitism.

1482821545403858945.text: Why do so many question the legitimacy of a Jewish state in the birthplace of the Jewish faith and the homeland of the Jewish people?

1482821544501989377.text: Why do synagogues across the US, and around the world, require extra security, every single day?  Why are Jews warned when traveling to hide any public displays of their faith?

1482821543579246594.text: Perhaps the question is not so much why did this one attacker chose a synagogue but why, irrespective of grievance, attacks disproportionately target synagogues and Jews?

1479096885965168643.text: The fact that so much remains unknown about those responsible for the day’s carnage only underscores the importance of the work of the Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol.

1479096885000523777.text: The deaths of Kevin Greeson, Benjamin Phillips, Rosanne Boyland, and Ashli Babbitt were all tragic, and wholly avoidable.

1479096884040024066.text: Responsibility for the blood shed and lives lost on January 6th lies firmly in the hands of the rally’s organizers.

1479096882970480641.text: Their absence is keenly felt by their family and friends; their memories will forever be a blessing for our nation.

1479096881863172097.text: more than 140 officers were injured, Officer Brian Sicknick died following the violence, and Officers Howard Liebengood, Jeffrey Smith, Kyle DeFreytag, and Gunther Hashida were all lost to suicide. Each of them bravely defended the Capitol.

1479096880722239493.text: Let us also always remember that our survival last January 6th did not come without costs. The U.S. Capitol Police and D.C. Metro Police suffered a terrible burden in defending the Capitol:

1479096879451418628.text: To secure faith in our elections, I urge the Senate to pass the Freedom to Vote Act. To combat rising extremism, I urge my colleagues to pass the bipartisan Domestic Terrorism Prevention Act introduced last year with my Senate colleague Dick Durbin.

1479096878214037507.text: If we want to continue pursuing the American experiment, fundamentally, every American today should be working to ensure that every ballot can be cast safely, that it will be counted fairly, and that the outcome of our elections will reflect the true will of the people.

1479096877090066432.text: There are no guarantees that our nation will persist as the kind of representative democracy our founders envisioned 250 years ago.

1479096875940728834.text: But we must also recognize that, one year later,  many of the underlying causes of the tragedy of January 6th remain – including continued disinformation campaigns, hyperpartisanship, and emboldened extremists willing to circumvent our electoral system.

1479096874770571265.text: We rightly celebrate the victory of democracy over violence last year.

1479096873633955846.text: Despite the siege of the Capitol, the insurrection, orchestrated by some at our government’s highest levels, failed at the end of the day, Congress completed its constitutional duties and two weeks later we witnessed a peaceful transition of power to a new administration.

1479096872539201540.text: From escaping  the House Gallery as a violent crowd tried to break through the chamber doors to defiantly returning later that evening to fulfill our job and certify the count of electoral ballots, the day for me represented the steely resilience of our democratic institutions.

1479096871490625543.text: January 6th is a day seared into my memory.

1460357788056662025.text: The new law will also invest in our clean energy future, helping to fund the construction of a robust electric vehicle charging network across the state, while also making the single biggest federal investment in our history towards climate resiliency.

1460357786513068043.text: Sewage and flooding improvements will be funded across flood-prone communities such as the Fox River, Des Plaines River, and the North Branch Chicago River Watersheds.

1460357785091252225.text: Illinois will receive more than $1.7 billion for clean water and lead water line replacement in towns like North Chicago and Waukegan, and many others.

1460357783656796169.text: The new law will provide Illinois with $4 billion to improve public transportation options, transforming everything from projects like our Metra system to the Pace bus routes across our district.

1460357781572177928.text: With the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, Illinois will receive more than $11 billion for road and bridge repair projects like improvements to east-west traffic along Illinois Route 120.

1460357773481418766.text: For years, our state has struggled with what has generously been evaluated to be C-grade infrastructure – and that’s only after grade inflation.

1460357772197998594.text: I know that this law will be a boon for Illinois.

1430611409910521856.text: As our two decade mission in Afghanistan comes to a close, we must remember and honor the service and sacrifice of our military, as well as the diplomats and others who have served our nation in Afghanistan over the last 20 years.

1430611408039862272.text: I am pleased  to report that, to date, my office has been involved in helping secure the passage of evacuees through the airport in Kabul, and we will continue to advocate on behalf of every person needing our assistance.

1430611406622232588.text: I am grateful that the Administration has provided direct channels for us to communicate the identities and status of all those seeking assistance in leaving the country.

1430611405250646020.text: Many constituents have reached out to my office to advocate on behalf of their family, friends, and loved ones still in Afghanistan.

1430611403891777537.text: Currently, the United States is conducting one of the largest air lifts in human history, having already evacuated more than 80,000 people from Afghanistan since August 14th, a pace that is only accelerating.

1430611402398568457.text: America must not leave Afghanistan until our mission is complete.

1430611400423059460.text: We also must evacuate those who have supported our mission, both military and diplomatically, and other Afghans at risk because of who they are, what they believe, or what the Afghanistan they’d hoped to live in looked like.

1430611398682464263.text: It is imperative that the United States preserves and expands its operational capabilities and capacities to evacuate all U.S. citizens and their families who desire to leave Afghanistan.

1332036344781156352.text: I want you to know that we will never forget the sacrifices you and your loved ones have made to battle this pandemic, and that I will continue to fight for you in Congress, funding the programs necessary to keep you in the fight and accelerate our distribution of vaccines.

1332036343904473089.text: Consider this note my way, on behalf of the 700,000+ people I represent, of cheering out our window to you.

1332036342935658502.text: As the months have passed, it can feel that America’s collective appreciation for the same work has waned, that the tedious nature of combatting a pandemic has dulled our vigor, or that we are suffering from “COVID fatigue.”

1332036342000332806.text: At the beginning of this pandemic, we all watched viral videos of people cheering out their windows to health care workers returning home from their long shifts.

1332036341027233792.text: So while it may feel that there is no rest for the weary, I want you to know that you are very much appreciated.

1332036340028993537.text: Many of you are working long, grinding shifts. Many of you won’t be able to see loved ones this holiday season. These sacrifices must certainly carry unbearable weight after months of tireless work.

1332036338997194752.text: Sadly, we are seeing more cases, more illness, and more deaths.  I know you experience each of these cases personally, and I can only imagine the emotional and professional pressure laid upon you. I also know each of you are making enormous sacrifices at home as well.

1332036338108030976.text: We know that we are calling on you to perform heroic acts, day in and day out.

1332036337147457539.text: You all have been working tirelessly for more than 9 months. And while the rest of us enjoyed the beautiful summer, you have been preparing for the surge we now face. Please know we see and we appreciate all you have done and all that we are asking of you now.

1332036336174444544.text: To the Drs, RNs, techs and others caring for patients; to the hospital admins, custodians, administrative assistants, and all who make that care possible; I want to convey to each of you my own, and our entire community’s, immense gratitude for your selfless work.

1332036335218139136.text: So in that spirit, let me also extend a heartfelt thanks for your dedication and sacrifice as we battle this pandemic.

1332036334312157184.text: Though this year will be unlike any other, we must not lose sight of the deeper meaning of the holiday.

1332036333318107139.text:

1305985762756882434.text: I look forward to continuing to work with my colleagues in Congress to help promote the conditions for that lasting peace and security.

1305985761922158598.text: As Bahrain’s Foreign Minister Abdullatif al Zayani put it, "Today's agreement is an important first step and it is now incumbent upon us to work urgently and actively to bring about the lasting peace and security our people deserve."

1305985761087553536.text: As Prime Minister Netanyahu today said, "those who bare the wounds of war cherish the blessings of peace." Those blessings will only be fully realized with hard work and continued United States engagement.

1305985760231911424.text: Just as we did then, we should mark this day with President Trump hosting Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the foreign ministers of UAE and Bahrain as hopefully a harbinger of more good things to come.

1305985759439196162.text: As well when President Clinton hosted Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin and King Hussein of Jordan in 1994.

1305985758419922945.text: The significance of today’s steps for peace is not lost on those of us who have sought it across the decades. I vividly remember when President Carter hosted Prime Minister Menachem Begin and President Anwar Sadat to sign the first peace agreement with Egypt in 1979.

1305985757224591361.text: I pray that these accords will open the door to a new era of peace between Israel and her neighbors, including progress to a negotiated two state solution to the Israeli/Palestinian conflict.

1305985756264095747.text:
Today, I was honored and humbled to personally witness the signing ceremony at the White House for the two historic peace agreements between the United Arab Emirates, Bahrain and Israel. 
https://t.co/ST7vsIq4YL

1305917568545443845.text: I also look forward to continuing to work with the Administration and my colleagues in Congress to promote future progress towards true and lasting peace, and bringing greater security to Israel, and all nations in the region.

1305917567714963456.text: Like with past agreements with Egypt and Jordan, the United States has always been a vital interlocutor, steadfast in our special alliance with Israel, including economic support and critical assurances of her qualitative military edge.

1305917566905397248.text: I pray that this momentum might ultimately forge a path to an agreement between Israel and the Palestinians, ensuring a secure, Jewish, democratic Israel living side-by-side with a Palestinian state with peace, security, and prosperity for both peoples.

1305917566049714181.text: Such an achievement would have been impossible without years of diligent work from Israel, the UAE, Bahrain, the State Department, and Presidential administrations going back generations.

1305917565219336192.text: Today's historic agreements to normalize relations between Israel and Bahrain and the UAE represent further movement toward better relations throughout the region and better security for Israel and her neighbors.

1248029768869728258.text: In my case, Julie and I will be celebrating tonight with our sons, my parents, my sisters and their kids, and dear family friends. We will be far removed but we will be close at heart and we will create new, loving memories.

1248029768131457024.text: But this year we need not be alone. In spite of the proper steps we are taking to physically isolate ourselves, we are finding new ways to connect with each other.

1248029767393255427.text: Obviously this year will be very different for most families. Elderly grandparents will be dining in solitude. Children working far from home will not be able to travel to unite with loved ones. Siblings living in neighboring towns will not be able to visit each other.

1118966594745532416.text: Since the beginning of the investigation, I have repeated that I will be guided by the facts and will follow them wherever they lead. Only by fully understanding what happened in 2016 will help us better defend against foreign efforts to influence future elections.

1118966594057777154.text: It is important that Congress review the full, unredacted report and that Special Counsel Mueller publicly testify to share these findings with the American public.

1118966592644231168.text: In particular, the Special Counsel report makes clear that the President sought repeatedly to undermine and interfere with the investigation, and in some instances was prevented from doing so only by his staff ignoring or refusing to carry out his instructions.

1118966591767678976.text: The facts as laid out in the report stand in stark contrast to Attorney General Barr’s attempts to spin the conclusions through a pre-release summary and press conference.

1118966591037870082.text: I am pleased that the Special Counsel report is finally public and the American people can now read the findings for themselves on foreign interference in the 2016 election.
